• 
Empiric antibiotic treatment should be broad as the etiology of necrotizing fasciitis can be 
polymicrobial (mixed aerobic–anaerobic microbes) or monomicrobial (group A streptococci, 
community-acquired MRSA). 
• 
Necrotizing fasciitis, also known as flesh-eating disease is a type of aggressive skin and soft 
tissue infection (SSTI) that spreads rapidly and can lead to death. 
 
Reference:
